body.p: A number of global DDS parameters can be configured:

row.entry: Specifies the DDS name that will be used during discovery.

Identifies the DDS environment type. By default this is supposed to be the 'C'-environment, but can be changed for other programming languages. DDS will try to optimize data transfers between participants with the same environment and endianness, and will try to avoid marshalling in that case. See the environment definitions in dds/dds_aux.h for the numbers to use.
Minimum time to delay to cleanup data when handling *_delete_contained_entities(). The default time is 50 us.
Maximum size of data samples (in bytes). Default this is set to 256 Mbytes per sample.

This is only meaningful when an application is compiled with -DDDS_FORWARD, to enable RTPS forwarding. It should be set to the actual forwarding mode (typically, either 0 to disable forwarding, which is the default, or 15 to enable full forwarding).

body.p: Sets the DDS application name to "TDDS Simple Application".
